column4: I put a DVD into my drive and though it says 3.8GB is used on the disc, it's not showing any files.. The same disc shows its contents properly in VMware though.. How do I fix this?
you are seeing it in vmware at the same time you are looking at it with the Linux OS?
Well I just booted VMware right now to check if it works in it. Before that too it wasn't showing up in Ubuntu
could be it wasent getting mounted to the right place, or was not automounting.
So what do I do to fix it
well check with the 'mount' command to see if its mounted someplace else. if its not mounted at all. You could try mounting it manually.
so wher does the mount command say its mounted to?
so you dont see any files in /media/cdrom0 eh?
interesting... try a 'sudo ls -l /media/cdrom0' perhaps? it may be mounted owned by root. Other then that. Id say unmount it.. and try remounting the cd.
sudo ls -l /media/cdrom0 says total 0. I tried unmounting but it says the device is busy
well if vmware is stillrunning. it may some how have it locked.
be sure ya got no terminals cd'd to it?  I forget the command now to see what may have it being accessed.. lsof /dev/cdrom perhaps.
Thanks, that command helped me fix it.
heh - what command? lsof? that sould of just read who is using the device.. it shouldent of fixed anything. :) Or was it magic! :)
